bill.title: An act relating to making appropriations for the support of government, financing education, and vital records
bill.description: An act relating to making appropriations for the support of government, financing education, and vital records

history.action: Committee Bill read first time
Rules Suspended and Taken up for Immediate Consideration as moved by Rep. Turner of Milton
Read Second Time
Rep. Devereux of Mount Holly spoke for the committee on Government Operations
Third Reading Ordered
Rules suspended and bill placed in all remaining stages of passage as moved by Rep. Turner of Milton
Read Third time and Passed
Rules suspended and bill messaged forthwith to the Senate as moved by Rep. Turner of Milton
Read 1st time & referred to Committee on Rules
Favorable report by Committee on Rules
Proposal of amendment to be offered by Senator(s) Kitchel, Cummings, Baruth, Ashe, Benning, Branagan, Bray, Brock, Campion, Lyons, MacDonald, McCormack, Nitka, Sirotkin, Starr, and Westman
Rules suspended & taken up for immediate consideration, on motion of Senator Ashe
Reported favorably by Senator Ashe for Committee on Rules
Proposal of amendment by Senator(s) Kitchel, Cummings, Baruth, Ashe, Benning, Branagan, Bray, Brock, Campion, Lyons, MacDonald, McCormack, Nitka, Sirotkin, Starr, and Westman; text
Proposal of amendment agreed to on roll call, requested by Senator Ashe, Passed -- Needed 14 of 27 to Pass -- Yeas = 27, Nays = 0
Proposal of amendment by Senator(s) Baruth; text
Proposal of amendment agreed to
Rules suspended & bill placed on all remaining stages of passage, on motion of Senator Ashe
Read 3rd time & passed in concurrence with proposal of amendment on roll call, requested by Senator Ashe, Passed -- Needed 14 of 27 to Pass -- Yeas = 27, Nays = 0
Rules suspended & messaged to House forthwith, on motion of Senator Ashe
Senate Message, passed in Concurrence with proposal of amendment
Rules Suspended and Taken up for Immediate Consideration as moved by Rep. Savage of Swanton
Rep. Poirier of Barre City raised a Point of Order
Which was disagreed to
Rep. Poirier of Barre City raised a Point of Order
Which was disagreed to
Roll Call Results Passed -- Needed 59 of 117 to Pass -- Yeas = 94, Nays = 23
Ruling of the Chair was challenged by Rep. Poirier of Barre City which ruling was upheld.
Senate Proposal of Amendment considered
Rep. Toll of Danville moved that the House concur in the Senate proposal of amendment with a further amendment thereto
Rep. Browning of Arlington, Sullivan of Dorset, and Wright of Burlington moved to substitute an amendment
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 56 of 110 to Pass -- Yeas = 42, Nays = 68
Which was disagreed to
Rep. Scheuermann of Stowe moved to amend the amendment offered by Rep. Toll of Danville
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 54 of 107 to Pass -- Yeas = 46, Nays = 61
Which was disagreed to
Senate Proposal of Amendment concurred in with further amendment thereto, as offered by Rep. Toll of Danville
Rep. Turner of Milton moved that the House reconsider its vote, which was agreed to.
Rep. Turner of Milton moved to substitute an amendment
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 63 of 125 to Pass -- Yeas = 51, Nays = 74
Which was disagreed to
Rep. Beck of St. Johnsbury moved to substitute an amendment
Which was disagreed to
Rep. Browning of Arlington moved to amend the proposal of amend offered by Rep. Toll of Danville
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 63 of 125 to Pass -- Yeas = 40, Nays = 85
Which was disagreed to
Senate Proposal of Amendment concurred in with further amendment thereto, as offered by Rep. Toll of Danville
House message House concurred in Senate proposal of amendment with proposal of amendment
Rules suspended & taken up for immediate consideration, on motion of Senator Ashe
House proposal of amendment to Senate proposal of amendment, text
House proposal of amendment to Senate proposal of amendment concurred in
Rules suspended & ordered delivered to Governor forthwith, on motion of Senator Ashe
Rules suspended & messaged to House forthwith, on motion of Senator Ashe
Senate Message, House proposal of amendment concurred in
Delivered to the Governor on June 25, 2018
Allowed to go into effect without the signature of the Governor on July 1, 2018
House message: Governor allowed to become law without signature on July 1, 2018
